duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the Infrastructure Section of the Systems Division, managing 21 staff members, an approximate budget of $4 million, and various projects and systems.
Exercise personnel management and strong leadership skills to build highly effective teams in a culture driven by team accomplishments and organizational advancement.
Guide staff members through complex projects using technical expertise and strategic planning.
Give presentations to Executive Management, other departments within the organization, and the Board of Trustees at monthly meetings.
Lead a variety of new projects, from initial planning process through final implementation of all IT business solutions.
Serve as a respectable representative of the organization while interfacing with vendors, contractors, and outside agencies.

education_certification.credential: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a closely related field; AND 5 years of progressively responsible, full-time, paid experience in a centralized Information Technology organization, performing information systems analysis and design, application development, network administration, or operating systems analysis; of which 2 years must be in a management capacity; OR 3 years of experience at the level of Information Technology Manager I, LACERA, or Information Technology Specialist I, LACERA; OR 5 years of progressively responsible, full-time, paid experience in managing the design, development, implementation, operation, and maintenance of a large complex information systems program in a large, multi-service public or private sector organization. A valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.
